result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric R Schroeder

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Eric R Schroeder in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Eric R Schroeder. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense is requesting a status in 30 days, has paper discovery but is awaiting electronic discovery (bodycam or audio). Defense also has not received an offer from the State. 
State will forward PTO to the Defense. State does not have any notes re: electronic discovery.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

8:26 AM Defendant Eric R Schroeder in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Eric R Schroeder.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2022 at 08:15 am.

9:36 AM Defendant Eric R Schroeder not in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes for attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Eric R Schroeder.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Andrea Will in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court states Atty. Griffis filed a letter requesting an adjournment. State requests bail be forfeited and capias be issued.  Atty. Hughes objects.  Court orders capias issued.
9:38 Defendant Eric R Schroeder in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes for attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Eric R Schroeder.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Andrea Will in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court withdraws bench warrant and reinstates bail previously ordered when case was called earlier this morning.
Court adjourns.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Atty Griffis request for adjournment **Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 9/8 "Unless objection from DA's Office, reschedule the matter as status on Prelim. and we will use the current date to reschedule, Defendant to appear in person; Marsy's Law issue, time limits have been waived. Defense counsel to have someone cover for selection of date or contact DA's Office and get an agreed upon date for the Prelim. which can be put on the record."
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

9:56 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  Defendant Eric R Schroeder in court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as to prelim hearing time limits.
Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Prior: 13515 Kenmar Ct, Brookfield, WI 53005
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Carter on 08/08/2022.
